title: Corpse
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

**Corpses** are the deceased remains of [monsters](/Monster "Monster"), and may be left behind (50% chance[\[1\]](#cite_note-1), or 100% in certain [vaults](/Vault "Vault")) when you kill them. They are not randomly generated on the floor. Like [skeletons](/Skeleton "Skeleton"), these items cannot be picked up. Corpses will eventually decompose into skeletons, which will decompose themselves into nothing. The corpse of any [unique monster](/Unique_monster "Unique monster") you kill will retain its name.

Corpses are mostly cosmetic, but are still used for a few mechanics in the game.

## Contents

- [1 Uses](#Uses)
  - [1.1 Death Drops](#Death_Drops)
- [2 Corpse Destroying Effects](#Corpse_Destroying_Effects)
- [3 History](#History)
  - [3.1 Butchering](#Butchering)
- [4 References](#References)

## Uses

- Followers of [Beogh](/Beogh "Beogh") can resurrect their allies only if they leave a corpse.
- [Cigotuvi's embrace](/Cigotuvi%27s_embrace "Cigotuvi's embrace") converts corpses into an AC bonus.

### Death Drops

Certain enemies may drop items if they leave behind a corpse, first. Effects like [Gozag](/Gozag "Gozag")'s gold touch and [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul")'s reaping will prevent corpses and their drops from appearing at all. Note that all displayed chances are effectively halved due to requiring a corpse in the first place.

- Slain [dragons](/List_of_dragons "List of dragons") may leave behind scales (66% chance[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)), which can be worn as a [body armour](/List_of_dragons#Dragon_Armour "List of dragons").
- Killing [trolls](/List_of_trolls "List of trolls") may leave behind a [troll leather armour](/Troll_leather_armour "Troll leather armour") (66% chance, like scales).
- Slain [eleionomae](/Eleionoma "Eleionoma") and [fenstrider witches](/Fenstrider_witch "Fenstrider witch") leave [wands](/Wands "Wands") (100% chance[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)).

These monsters will still drop items, even if their body has otherwise exploded (such as from a [wand of mindburst](/Wand_of_mindburst "Wand of mindburst")).

## Corpse Destroying Effects

While most effects are no longer tied to corpses directly, some require that the corpse isn't "destroyed". The following effects conflict with each other, in order of highest priority to lowest:[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

- - **1.** The monster spell, [Bind Souls](/Bind_Souls "Bind Souls"), takes priority over all player effects. [Gozag](/Gozag "Gozag") prevents this effect from happening, however.

  - **2.** The [Infestation](/Infestation "Infestation") spell takes priority over all other player effects, even those granted by [gods](/God "God").

  - **3.** [Gozag](/Gozag "Gozag")'s gold touch. Gozag turns flesh into gold, preventing the corpse from being used.

  - **4.** Kills from a [wand of mindburst](/Wand_of_mindburst "Wand of mindburst"), [orb of destruction](/Orb_of_destruction "Orb of destruction"), and deaths during [Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame") will cause monsters to explode, leaving gory bits and an unusable corpse. Followers of Gozag spray gold all over the place. Does *not* prevent any form of [death drop](#Death_Drops).

  - **5.** [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul")'s zombie reaping. If the corpse is intact, a [zombie](/Zombie "Zombie") is made. If the corpse was destroyed, or the monster couldn't drop a corpse, a [spectral thing](/Spectral_thing "Spectral thing") is made instead.

  - **6.** Other [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy") effects, in the following order:

    - [Simulacrum](/Simulacrum "Simulacrum")
    - [Animate Dead](/Animate_Dead "Animate Dead") and the [reaping](/Reaping "Reaping") brand
    - [Necrotise](/Necrotise "Necrotise")

  - **7.** There's a 50% chance for a corpse item to be created on the floor, creating [death drops](#Death_Drops) if a monster can leave one.

  - **8.** [Cigotuvi's embrace](/Cigotuvi%27s_embrace "Cigotuvi's embrace") absorbs corpses on the floor, increasing the armour's AC bonus.

These do *not* rely on the corpse itself dropping. Effects like Infestation and Gozag's gold touch will work on monsters that won't ever leave a corpse.

## History

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), corpses could be used for [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy").
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), you could but'**c'**her corpses for [food](/Comestible "Comestible"). See below for more details.
- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), [vampires](/Vampire "Vampire") could either immediately "**e**at" corpses, draining the blood out of them, or "but**c**her" them, bottling their blood to save for later.
- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), [Fedhas Madash](/Fedhas_Madash "Fedhas Madash") appreciated allowing corpses to decay and allowed its followers to grow [toadstools](/Toadstool "Toadstool") and [ballistomycete spores](/Ballistomycete_spore "Ballistomycete spore") from them.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), followers of [Lugonu](/Lugonu "Lugonu") or [Trog](/Trog "Trog") could sacrifice corpses for piety by **p**raying over a fresh corpse..
- Prior to [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), corpses would become rotten after some time had passed, but before they decayed into skeletons. Also, followers of [Okawaru](/Okawaru "Okawaru") or [Makhleb](/Makhleb "Makhleb") could sacrifice corpses for piety.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), players were able to pick up and transport corpses. Also, contaminated and contaminated + poisonous corpses existed.
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), corpses also sprouted [toadstools](/Toadstool "Toadstool") even when the player was not a worshiper of [Fedhas](/Fedhas "Fedhas").
- In [0.8](/0.8 "0.8"), contaminated + poisonous corpses were added.

### Butchering

- Prior to [0.23](/0.23 "0.23"), butchering a corpse did not always leave a skeleton.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), butchering dragon or troll corpses sometimes left behind hides, which could then be turned into proper armour with a [scroll of enchant armour](/Scroll_of_enchant_armour "Scroll of enchant armour").
- Prior to [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), butchering took 4 turns instead of 1.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), players in [Wisp Form](/Wisp_Form "Wisp Form") or [Fungus Form](/Fungus_Form "Fungus Form") could not butcher corpses.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), players could not butcher corpses while in [Spider Form](/Spider_Form "Spider Form"), [Pig Form](/Pig_Form "Pig Form"), or [Porcupine Form](/Porcupine_Form "Porcupine Form").
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), the player character was unable to butcher corpses while wielding [cursed](/Curse "Curse") blunt weapons. Although, there were many exceptions: players with a [beak](/Beak "Beak") and [talons](/Talons "Talons") could always chop corpses, as players with [fangs](/Fangs "Fangs")-3 (but not [Vampires](/Vampires "Vampires")), and players with [claws](/Claws "Claws") (unless they had [cursed](/Curse "Curse") gloves).
- Prior to [0.9](/0.9 "0.9"), you needed to carry an edged weapon to butcher.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [mon-death.cc:547](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.29.0/crawl-ref/source/mon-death.cc#L547) (0.29.0)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [mon-death.cc:512](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.29.0/crawl-ref/source/mon-death.cc#L512) (0.29.0)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [mon-death.cc:516](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.29.0/crawl-ref/source/mon-death.cc#L516) (0.29.0)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [mon-death.cc:1401](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/mon-death.cc#L1401) (0.30.0)
html:
Corpse

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

Corpses are the deceased remains of monsters, and may be left behind (50% chance[1], or 100% in certain vaults) when you kill them. They are not randomly generated on the floor. Like skeletons, these items cannot be picked up. Corpses will eventually decompose into skeletons, which will decompose themselves into nothing. The corpse of any unique monster you kill will retain its name.

Corpses are mostly cosmetic, but are still used for a few mechanics in the game.

Contents

  • 1 Uses
    • 1.1 Death Drops
  • 2 Corpse Destroying Effects
  • 3 History
    • 3.1 Butchering
  • 4 References

Uses

  • Followers of Beogh can resurrect their allies only if they leave a corpse.
  • Cigotuvi's embrace converts corpses into an AC bonus.

Death Drops

Certain enemies may drop items if they leave behind a corpse, first. Effects like Gozag's gold touch and Yredelemnul's reaping will prevent corpses and their drops from appearing at all. Note that all displayed chances are effectively halved due to requiring a corpse in the first place.

  • Slain dragons may leave behind scales (66% chance[2]), which can be worn as a body armour.
  • Killing trolls may leave behind a troll leather armour (66% chance, like scales).
  • Slain eleionomae and fenstrider witches leave wands (100% chance[3]).

These monsters will still drop items, even if their body has otherwise exploded (such as from a wand of mindburst).

Corpse Destroying Effects

While most effects are no longer tied to corpses directly, some require that the corpse isn't "destroyed". The following effects conflict with each other, in order of highest priority to lowest:[4]

1. The monster spell, Bind Souls, takes priority over all player effects. Gozag prevents this effect from happening, however.
2. The Infestation spell takes priority over all other player effects, even those granted by gods.
3. Gozag's gold touch. Gozag turns flesh into gold, preventing the corpse from being used.
4. Kills from a wand of mindburst, orb of destruction, and deaths during Inner Flame will cause monsters to explode, leaving gory bits and an unusable corpse. Followers of Gozag spray gold all over the place. Does not prevent any form of death drop.
5. Yredelemnul's zombie reaping. If the corpse is intact, a zombie is made. If the corpse was destroyed, or the monster couldn't drop a corpse, a spectral thing is made instead.
6. Other Necromancy effects, in the following order:
  • Simulacrum
  • Animate Dead and the reaping brand
  • Necrotise
7. There's a 50% chance for a corpse item to be created on the floor, creating death drops if a monster can leave one.
8. Cigotuvi's embrace absorbs corpses on the floor, increasing the armour's AC bonus.

These do not rely on the corpse itself dropping. Effects like Infestation and Gozag's gold touch will work on monsters that won't ever leave a corpse.

History

  • Prior to 0.29, corpses could be used for Necromancy.
  • Prior to 0.26, you could but'c'her corpses for food. See below for more details.
  • Prior to 0.24, vampires could either immediately "eat" corpses, draining the blood out of them, or "butcher" them, bottling their blood to save for later.
  • Prior to 0.24, Fedhas Madash appreciated allowing corpses to decay and allowed its followers to grow toadstools and ballistomycete spores from them.
  • Prior to 0.17, followers of Lugonu or Trog could sacrifice corpses for piety by praying over a fresh corpse..
  • Prior to 0.16, corpses would become rotten after some time had passed, but before they decayed into skeletons. Also, followers of Okawaru or Makhleb could sacrifice corpses for piety.
  • Prior to 0.15, players were able to pick up and transport corpses. Also, contaminated and contaminated + poisonous corpses existed.
  • Prior to 0.12, corpses also sprouted toadstools even when the player was not a worshiper of Fedhas.
  • In 0.8, contaminated + poisonous corpses were added.

Butchering

  • Prior to 0.23, butchering a corpse did not always leave a skeleton.
  • Prior to 0.19, butchering dragon or troll corpses sometimes left behind hides, which could then be turned into proper armour with a scroll of enchant armour.
  • Prior to 0.16, butchering took 4 turns instead of 1.
  • Prior to 0.15, players in Wisp Form or Fungus Form could not butcher corpses.
  • Prior to 0.14, players could not butcher corpses while in Spider Form, Pig Form, or Porcupine Form.
  • Prior to 0.12, the player character was unable to butcher corpses while wielding cursed blunt weapons. Although, there were many exceptions: players with a beak and talons could always chop corpses, as players with fangs-3 (but not Vampires), and players with claws (unless they had cursed gloves).
  • Prior to 0.9, you needed to carry an edged weapon to butcher.

References

  1. ↑ mon-death.cc:547 (0.29.0)
  2. ↑ mon-death.cc:512 (0.29.0)
  3. ↑ mon-death.cc:516 (0.29.0)
  4. ↑ mon-death.cc:1401 (0.30.0)

rawPage:
{{version030}}
'''Corpses''' are the deceased remains of [[monster]]s, and may be left behind (50% chance<ref>{{source ref|0.29.0|mon-death.cc|547}}</ref>, or 100% in certain [[vault]]s) when you kill them. They are not randomly generated on the floor. Like [[skeleton]]s, these items cannot be picked up. Corpses will eventually decompose into skeletons, which will decompose themselves into nothing. The corpse of any [[unique monster]] you kill will retain its name.

Corpses are mostly cosmetic, but are still used for a few mechanics in the game.

==Uses==
*Followers of [[Beogh]] can resurrect their allies only if they leave a corpse.
*[[Cigotuvi's embrace]] converts corpses into an AC bonus.

===Death Drops===
Certain enemies may drop items if they leave behind a corpse, first. Effects like [[Gozag]]'s gold touch and [[Yredelemnul]]'s reaping will prevent corpses and their drops from appearing at all. Note that all displayed chances are effectively halved due to requiring a corpse in the first place.

*Slain [[list of dragons|dragons]] may leave behind scales (66% chance<ref>{{source ref|0.29.0|mon-death.cc|512}}</ref>), which can be worn as a [[List of dragons#Dragon Armour|body armour]]. 
*Killing [[list of trolls|trolls]] may leave behind a [[troll leather armour]] (66% chance, like scales).
*Slain [[eleionoma]]e and [[fenstrider witch]]es leave [[wands]] (100% chance<ref>{{source ref|0.29.0|mon-death.cc|516}}</ref>).

These monsters will still drop items, even if their body has otherwise exploded (such as from a [[wand of mindburst]]).

==Corpse Destroying Effects==
While most effects are no longer tied to corpses directly, some require that the corpse isn't "destroyed". The following effects conflict with each other, in order of highest priority to lowest:<ref>{{source ref|0.30.0|mon-death.cc|1401}}</ref>

: '''1.''' The monster spell, [[Bind Souls]], takes priority over all player effects. [[Gozag]] prevents this effect from happening, however.
: '''2.''' The [[Infestation]] spell takes priority over all other player effects, even those granted by [[god]]s.
: '''3.''' [[Gozag]]'s gold touch. Gozag turns flesh into gold, preventing the corpse from being used.
: '''4.''' Kills from a [[wand of mindburst]], [[orb of destruction]], and deaths during [[Inner Flame]] will cause monsters to explode, leaving gory bits and an unusable corpse. Followers of Gozag spray gold all over the place. Does ''not'' prevent any form of [[#Death Drops|death drop]].
: '''5.''' [[Yredelemnul]]'s zombie reaping. If the corpse is intact, a [[zombie]] is made. If the corpse was destroyed, or the monster couldn't drop a corpse, a [[spectral thing]] is made instead.
: '''6.''' Other [[Necromancy]] effects, in the following order:
:* [[Simulacrum]]
:* [[Animate Dead]] and the [[reaping]] brand
:* [[Necrotise]]
: '''7.''' There's a 50% chance for a corpse item to be created on the floor, creating [[#Death Drops|death drops]] if a monster can leave one.
: '''8.''' [[Cigotuvi's embrace]] absorbs corpses on the floor, increasing the armour's AC bonus.

These do ''not'' rely on the corpse itself dropping. Effects like Infestation and Gozag's gold touch will work on monsters that won't ever leave a corpse.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.29]], corpses could be used for [[Necromancy]].
*Prior to [[0.26]], you could but''''c''''her corpses for [[comestible|food]]. See below for more details.
*Prior to [[0.24]], [[vampire]]s could either immediately "'''e'''at" corpses, draining the blood out of them, or "but'''c'''her" them, bottling their blood to save for later.
*Prior to [[0.24]], [[Fedhas Madash]] appreciated allowing corpses to decay and allowed its followers to grow [[toadstool]]s and [[ballistomycete spore]]s from them.
*Prior to [[0.17]], followers of [[Lugonu]] or [[Trog]] could sacrifice corpses for piety by '''p'''raying over a fresh corpse..
*Prior to [[0.16]], corpses would become rotten after some time had passed, but before they decayed into skeletons. Also, followers of [[Okawaru]] or [[Makhleb]] could sacrifice corpses for piety.
*Prior to [[0.15]], players were able to pick up and transport corpses. Also, contaminated and contaminated + poisonous corpses existed.
*Prior to [[0.12]], corpses also sprouted [[toadstool]]s even when the player was not a worshiper of [[Fedhas]].
*In [[0.8]], contaminated + poisonous corpses were added.

===Butchering===
*Prior to [[0.23]], butchering a corpse did not always leave a skeleton.
*Prior to [[0.19]], butchering dragon or troll corpses sometimes left behind hides, which could then be turned into proper armour with a [[scroll of enchant armour]].
*Prior to [[0.16]], butchering took 4 turns instead of 1.
*Prior to [[0.15]], players in [[Wisp Form]] or [[Fungus Form]] could not butcher corpses.
*Prior to [[0.14]], players could not butcher corpses while in [[Spider Form]], [[Pig Form]], or [[Porcupine Form]].
*Prior to [[0.12]], the player character was unable to butcher corpses while wielding [[curse]]d blunt weapons. Although, there were many exceptions: players with a [[beak]] and [[talons]] could always chop corpses, as players with [[fangs]]-3 (but not [[Vampires]]), and players with [[claws]] (unless they had [[curse]]d gloves).
*Prior to [[0.9]], you needed to carry an edged weapon to butcher.
